title: oh look ricklessabandon

replies.body: I've come to realize by now that if you like a champion, the worst news you could possibly receive is that good old Rickless is going to work on them.
R.I.P {{champion:84}}
Wait, was he like in charge of the entire assassin update?

He was in-charge of doing the Akali mini-rework during the assassin update. He wasn't the designer that was in-charge of LB's rework, but I believe he was in-charge of the nerfs to LB some patches ago that gutted her W that resulted her to use Gunblade+Lich Bane build.
He also did Shaco. Great track record.
I find her easier to be effective with past silver elo now.

Each to their own, but shroud with pinks didn't stop multiple Challenger/Master Akali OTPs from playing her. The rework loss these high elo Akali players more than they gained.

Also, her pickrate for mid lane shifted to top lane by alot. Before the rework, it was more or less even.

>Also, her pickrate for mid lane shifted to top lane by alot.

That's because she doesn't have the damage to kill anybody in midlane faster than they can kill her. Her niche now is exploiting her mobility in the long lane and outsustaining tanks, then using her W dash to disengage after splitpushing a-la Tryndamere spin. It completey killed her midlane roam assassin playstyle, which was what most people who played her enjoyed. 

She's still a viable champion in her own right, but with a diametrically different playstyle (which IMO is rather unfun).

Overall I would say Akali's is safer early game, less snowbally, better when behind and not countered by a 75 gold item. She can do great or terable but the extremes seem far less drastic.

They trimmed her extremes.

She was never countered by pink wards because nobody with a brain would rely on the shroud around somebody with a pink in their inventory. They would either bait the pink beforehand and make them waste a potion and half worth of gold or allow it to sit in their inventory which meant the pink wouldn't be used to gather vision to prevent ganks. And the longer the game progressed, the greater the opportunity cost of wasting an inv slot on the offchance they'd need it. 

Now instead of pink wards she's soft countered by any AOE or DoT ability, which makes her flicker and vulnerable to skillshots, and outright countered by tether abilities like Karma's E (?) or Kled's Q, which make her straight out targetable in shroud. Which ones do you think are more common, wards or AOE/DoT/tethers? 

That's why I hate it when people act like the pink ward thing was a buff to her. It wasn't, it was a straight out nerf and a big one at that.

Generally speaking. (As someone who's played quite a bit of akali)

They made her pre-6 much stronger, but with the same essential weakness of "lack of engage" but made her post 6 spike much weaker, giving her pressure more then damage.
"Let's just give her a 4th dash then gut her everywhere else, that'll make her healthy haha..."
Goal wasn't to make her healthy. It was to keep her in line.
She was already in line with a pretty stable 50% winrate.

No, she wasn't.
Because her old Assassin burst pattern would've made sure that if all other assassins got a delay, that she would take their place. The goal of the Assassin update was to give all the assassins the delay, making them equal but distinct in what they're trying to provide for the team.

Furthermore, Akali is far from useless right now.
All people cried wolf before they actually tried her and then it turned out Akali heals for absurd amounts of HP with Gunblade, once she takes off. She's still weak in the early game.

Win rate of a champion isn't everything you need to know if they're in or out of line.
Win rate is just one statistic that can tell you if something is wrong but even if it's a stable 50%, the champion in question might not have a kit that's fair to play as or against it.

>Furthermore, Akali is far from useless right now.

She is useless in her intended role which is a roaming midlane assassin and has to make do with being a bad Tryndamere. Her playrate has more than halved after the rework and the only reason her winrate isn't atrocious is because she's mostly only played by people experienced with her now, as evidenced by comparing the average number of games played on her per player from before and after the update.

You're comparing Akali to Tryndamere?
They aren't even in the same class. Trnyda, once he dies once, is doomed to be a liability to his team and splitpush constantly or he waits for the late game to get items and then turns 0/100 to 100/100. Tryndamere, regardless of how he's doing, is just a champion with a dated kit that doesn't work.

If Akali is being played by experienced Akali players and they have a decent win rate, doesn't that mean she's not bad? Not every champion needs to appeal to the masses or can. Every champion is going to have a dedicated part of the community who either one-tricks them, prefer playing them or don't mind playing them. The rest are going to be playing someone else.

You're completely right despite the guy below and the downvote. 50% winrate =/= balanced. That just means she was performing to an average level with a toxic kit.

There's plenty of champs to point to that had 50%~ winrates in the past that were actually completely toxic. Not everyone can hop off the bandwagon though.
And whoever said 50% winrate equals balanced?
You
No, I did not. I have no idea where you got that.
Insinuated it.

I insinuated no such thing, you just read (or didn't read) what you wanted into my post. She was unhealthy and in line with a stable winrate. She's still unhealthy but now with a winrate that looks like the output of a seismograph in Japan. Her rework solved nothing, which is my point. 

And if you agree with the statement that her rework wasn't meant to make her healthy, then why are you arguing about toxic kits? By that statement the rework wasn't trying to address it in the first place.
I genuinely loved what he did to Ahri in 3.13 with the Kiss of Death Charm amplification...buuuut, that was just one champion.
And the same guy removed Charm stopping dashes :^).
That was SmashGizmo, not Rickless. Unless I'm misremembering.
Possible, but I'm unsure.
Yes it was SmashGizmo. He had that twitlonger post explaining to an Ahri player on why he was removing it.
Consistency's a bitch, ain't it?
Didn't say he shouldn't have done it, but it was a good form of skill expression.

Yeah, I get that. It's just kinda weird that it was even there in the first place - the only dashes that get interrupted by move commands are ones that get canceled by damage, and iirc none of them even existed before this change.
I dunno, Charm has had and still has a lot of weird interactions. Stormraider's ignores Charm's slow and makes you run mach 2 at Ahri, despite how Yi gets slowed through his R.

Highlander not affecting it seems like a bug, because any slow resistance lower than 100% ( like Stormraider's Surge or Swifties ) is the one thing that actually mucks with the movement speed set.

Then again, I suppose it's a lot more likely that slow resistance affecting it is a bug, considering it's a fair bit newer than Highlander.

As far as I'm aware, E slowing Yi is intended as it'd be suicide and that's the only defense Ahri has against Yi running at her. However, it's the inconsistency with Stormraider's that makes it an odd interaction.

To be fair, charm is probably the third worst crowd control in concept to use to get away from someone, only beaten by taunt and forced movement that pulls the target to you.  Plus it still provides the forced movement orders for a while, giving you a better chance to either kill him off or Flash / R over a wall if you really need to get out of dodge.

Of course, I won't deny my incredible bias towards the hilarity of the Wuju master going completely **"MMMMMMMM GIMME DAT BOOTY"** if Ahri uses her E on him at the wrong ( right? ) time.
It'd still be counter-intuitive to have Yi's one hard counter being CC, yet having Ahri's one CC be virtual suicide.

Eh, it'd be based on the situation. If Ahri used her E on a Highlander'd Yi while her team was around her, she'd pull him _way_ in the middle of them and then that Yi would become a very sad, very dead Yi. Besides, even 1v1 you're still silencing + disarming him for some breathing room where he can't kill or Q you to follow you over walls _and_ if he's trying to run away that just mean he loses that much more distance, plus slows are _explicitly_ exceptions on the "Yi is weak to CC" tip ... while his ult is off cooldown or active, anyway.

Thinking about it, it would actually be a buff for the most part, only really a nerf in this single ( albeit not exactly uncommon ) situation where you're within walking distance of safety and you need to to use the charm's move speed set to make sure Yi doesn't just Q you and run away as soon as you reach the threshold.
i mean the part where it stopped dashes was a cool mechanic but it stopping stuff like malphite ultimate was just dumb.
Charm stopping Unstoppable effects was fixed before the removal of stopping dashes.

He probably did something nice I don't remember, and half of his pbe item changes look promising (the other half falling into what I'm about to say), but ricklessabandon just sits in my memory as "Guy who does arbitrary, convoluted changes that achieve nothing in the long run".

I'm glad you picked up on that, I didn't even notice that RE nerf from 50% > 30%. If they're gonna keep those values they might as well give back the damage component. I don't know why Riot is so content to just play around with her numbers, their rework is a failure and it's about time they accepted that.
I also think that just number tuning is a bad idea, considering that number-wise Karma is far from overpowered - 48% in gold+, decreases in higher elos. This nerf is going to put her in ~45-47% zone.

I agree, this is why the Karma community has been saying for years that Riot took her in the wrong direction. They changed her kit in a way that made her dependant on high numbers in order to be good, because they forced into a playstyle which competes directly with Lulu and Janna.

Prior to 5.10 when they destroyed her identity, Karma was a strong anti assassin duelist who excelled in clumpy team fights. She was weak against champs that outranged her, and the high mobility champs who could break her tether and re-engage her. She should have been left alone, in her own little space.
Ricklessabandon? The guy that made{{champion:7}} rely on her point and click more since he gutted W? Yeah that guy is something else :)
x2 point and click since gutting her W made her start picking up {{item:3146}}
If by point and click you mean a skill shot, then yes

Well yeah. The whole point of the changes were to nerf Karma's shielding. Right now, a lot of people are complaining about shields being too strong (Karma, Janna, and Lulu). I guess this is just Riot addressing it.

The problem is, Rickless went into a lot of trouble removing the damage from her RE and buffing her passive to compensate, all so he could increase her shield values in the name of "increasing contextual decision making". To get to this point now where the shield is weaker than it originally was when it dealt damage... makes his changes seem pointless. It was a failure in everything it set out to achieve.
